intro: Scabiosa hirsuta, commonly known as hairy scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Scabiosa hirsuta is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
